trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of AVE5026 as Compared to Enoxaparin for the Prevention of Thromboembolism in Patients Undergoing Total Hip Replacement Surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Multinational, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of AVE5026 With Enoxaparin for the Prevention of Venous Thromboembolism in Patients Undergoing Elective Total Hip Replacement Surgery

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Semuloparin sodium Treatment: drugs - Enoxaparin sodium Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Experimental: Semuloparin - Semuloparin sodium 20 mg (10 mg if Severe Renal Impairment [SRI]) once daily for 7-10 days with an initial dose given 8 hours after surgery Placebo for Enoxaparin sodium prior to surgery according to local standard for Enoxaparin and 12 hours after surgery to maintain the blind
Active Comparator: Enoxaparin - Enoxaparin sodium 40 mg (20 mg if Severe Renal Impairment [SRI]) once daily for 7-10 days with an initial dose given prior to or 12 hours after surgery according to local standard for Enoxaparin sodium Placebo for Semuloparin sodium 8 hours after surgery to maintain the blind
Treatment: drugs: Semuloparin sodium 0.4 mL (0.2 mL if SRI) solution in ready-to-use 0.5 ml pre-filled syringe Subcutaneous injection
Treatment: drugs: Enoxaparin sodium 0.4 mL (0.2 mL if SRI) solution in ready-to-use 0.5 ml pre-filled syringe Subcutaneous injection
Treatment: drugs: Placebo 0.4 mL (0.2 mL if SRI) solution in ready-to-use 0.5 ml pre-filled syringe strictly identical in appearance but without active component Subcutaneous injection

primaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Venous Thromboembolism Event [VTE] or Death From Any Cause - VTE included any proximal or distal Deep Vein Thrombosis [DVT] (symptomatic or not) and non-fatal Pulmonary Embolism [PE] as confirmed by a Central Independent Adjudication Committee [CIAC] after review of mandatory bilateral venograms and diagnostic tests for VTE. All-cause deaths included fatal PE and deaths for other reason than PE.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: From randomization up to 10 days after surgery or the day of mandatory venography, whichever came first

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced "Major" VTE or All-cause Death - "major" VTE included any proximal DVT, symptomatic distal DVT and nonfatal Pulmonary Embolism (PE) as confirmed by the CIAC.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From randomization up to 10 days after surgery or the day of mandatory venography, whichever came first
From first study drug injection up to 3 days after last study drug injection

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of Participants Who Required the Initiation of Curative Anticoagulant or Thrombolytic Treatment After VTE Assessment - Initiation of curative anticoagulant or thrombolytic treatment after VTE assessment was defined from investigator's answer to the question "was the subject treated for VTE?" asked after the diagnostic tests for suspected VTE and after the mandatory venography.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: From randomization up to 10 days after surgery or the day of mandatory venography, whichever came first

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - Elective total hip replacement surgery or a revision of at least one component of a prosthesis implanted = 6 months prior to study entry.

recruitment.hospital: sanofi-aventis Australia & New Zealand administrative office - Macquarie Park

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The primary objective was to compare the efficacy of once daily [q.d.] subcutaneous [s.c.] injections of Semuloparin sodium (AVE5026) with q.d. s.c. injections of enoxaparin for the prevention of Venous Thromboembolic Events [VTE] in patients undergoing elective total hip replacement surgery.
The secondary objectives were to evaluate the safety of AVE5026 in patients undergoing elective total hip replacement surgery, and to document AVE5026 exposure in this population.

contact.name: Patrick MOURET, MD
contact.address: Orthopädische Klinik, Stätische Klinik, Gotenstrasse 6-8, Frankfurt Höechst, 65929 Frankfurt, Germany
